trial_identification.studytitle: Perceptions of podiatrists and runners towards minimalist shoe running
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Perceptions of podiatrists and runners towards minimalist shoe running

conditions.healthcondition: Perceptions of podiatrists and minimalist shoe runners towards minimalist shoe running

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal musculoskeletal and cartilage development and function

interventions.interventions:
The sole objective of this study is to explore perceptions towards minimalist shoe running style by podiatrists practicing in Western Australia and runners.
Each participant will complete a single online survey which should take approximately 10-20 min
The data from each separate cohort will be collected over a period of three months

primaryOutcome.outcome:
The statistical package SPSS (Statistical Package for Social Sciences) will be employed to analyse all quantitative data collected from all completed online surveys. Examples of statistical tests that may be used to analyse the data include the Pearson Chi-squared test, for bivariate analysis, and the Mann-Whitney U test, for multivariate analysis.
The outcome actually is the perceptions of podiatrists and the community towards minimalist shoe running
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Timeline expected taken for collecting the data from 01/05/2013 to 31/07/2013

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Three main separate cohorts including: 1. Current Western Australia registered podiatrists 2. Runners who never use minimalist shoes before 3. Runners who are currently running with minimalist shoes
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
Runners: -Runners just started to run minimalist shoes (MS) -Runners with chronic diseases: diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis -Runners with any foot pain or foot pathology -No consent
Podiatrists: -Non-practicing podiatrists -Student podiatrists -Podiatrists from other states and other countries -No consent

trial_design.statisticalmethods: The statistical package SPSS (Statistical Package for Social Sciences) will be employed to analyse all quantitative data collected from all completed online surveys. Examples of statistical tests that may be used to analyse the data include the Pearson Chi-squared test, for bivariate analysis, and the Mann-Whitney U test, for multivariate analysis

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The sole objective of this study is to explore perceptions towards minimalist shoe running style by podiatrists practicing in Western Australia and runners.
